com.gl.vn.me.ko.pies.platform.server.tcp

Class TcpServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gl.vn.me.ko.pies.platform.server.tcp.TcpServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Server
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RestServer, TcpReverseProxyServer

    @ThreadSafe
public class TcpServer
extends Object
implements Server
    A TCP implementation of the Server interface.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TcpServer

        @Inject
public TcpServer(@TcpServerAddress
                         InetSocketAddress address,
                         @TcpServerName
                         String name,
                         @TcpServerBoss
                         Integer maxBossThreads,
                         @TcpServerWorker
                         Integer maxWorkerThreads,
                         @TcpServerThreadFactory
                         ThreadFactory threadFactory,
                         @TcpServerBoss @Nullable
                         ChannelInitializer<ServerSocketChannel> serverSocketChannelInitializer,
                         @TcpServerWorker @Nullable
                         ChannelInitializer<SocketChannel> workerSocketChannelInitializer)
        Constructs a new instance of TcpServer.
        Parameters:
        address - An InetSocketAddress the TcpServer will listen to.
        name - A name of the TcpServer.
        maxBossThreads - Maximum number of Threads that accept new TCP connections.
        maxWorkerThreads - Maximum number of Threads that process data received via the accepted TCP connections.
        threadFactory - A ThreadFactory that will be used to create boss and worker Threads. Thread names MAY not be the same as the threadFactory generates.
        serverSocketChannelInitializer - A ChannelInitializer that will be used to initialize a ServerSocketChannel that is bound to the address. If this argument is null then default ChannelInitializer, that adds a LoggingHandler with LogLevel.DEBUG, will be used.
        workerSocketChannelInitializer - A ChannelInitializer that will be used to initialize a SocketChannels that are children of the ServerSocketChannel. If this argument is null then default ChannelInitializer, that adds a LoggingHandler with LogLevel.DEBUG, will be used.

    • Method Detail

      • getServerBootstrap

        protected final ServerBootstrap getServerBootstrap()
        Returns ServerBootstrap. Subclasses MAY use it to tune TcpServer before the first invocation of start(). Generally this means that ServerBootstrap SHOULD only be used from constructors of subclasses.
        Returns:
        Returns ServerBootstrap.

      • shutdown

        public final void shutdown()
        Performs a shutdown procedure. After completion of this method Server doesn't perform I/O and any other operations anymore. This method MUST be idempotent.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface Server
        See Also:
        shutdownHook()

      • shutdownHook

        protected void shutdownHook()
        Subclasses MAY implement this method in order to perform shutdown actions; this implementation does nothing. This method is called from the shutdown() method and MAY be not idempotent.

      • start

        public final Future<?> start()
                      throws InterruptedException
        Performs a start procedure. After completion of this method Server is able to perform I/O operations until Server.shutdown() is invoked.

        Once the Server.start() method is called the Server.shutdown() method MUST be called later. A suggested approach to start, wait and shutdown a Server is following: 

        
 final Server server = ...
 try {
        final Future<?> completion = server.start();
        ... // do something else if you need to
        completion.await();
 } catch (final InterruptedException e) {
        // shutdown() called in finally block is our reaction on interruption
        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
 } finally {
        server.shutdown();
 }
        Two invocations of the Server.start() method on the same Server MUST be separated with Server.shutdown() method invocation. Server implementation MUST explicitly specify if it supports multiple Server.start() & Server.shutdown() procedures, otherwise one MUST NOT invoke Server.start() method more than one time for a given Server instance.

        This method MUST NOT be called more than once on the same instance of TcpServer.

        Specified by:
        start in interface Server
        Returns:
        Future that MAY be used to wait till the Server operates. After completion of this Future the method Server.shutdown() MUST be called in order to correctly shutdown the Server.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the current Thread is interrupted.
        See Also:
        Server.shutdown()

      • getName

        protected final String getName()
        Returns name of the TcpServer.

      • getState

        protected final boolean getState()
        Returns if the TcpServer active or wasn't started, or was shut down.
        Returns:
